verbose_text: Surface exposed HtpB, which increases in the presence of mammalian host cells, as well as during the morphological differentiation of L. pneumophila into mature infectious forms, interacts with eukaryotic cell receptors and mediates attachment to and invasion of host cells.
evidence: HtpB, which increases in the presence of mammalian host cells, as well as during the morphological differentiation of L. pneumophila into mature infectious forms, interacts with eukaryotic cell receptors and mediates attachment to and invasion
